title: 104_s1487
content: The Act is titled the "Uniformed Services Medicare Subvention Demonstration Project Act" and includes definitions for key terms. The Act defines key terms such as "medicare-eligible covered military beneficiary" and "TRICARE program" under chapter 55 of title 10, United States Code. The Act defines key terms related to the TRICARE program and military treatment facilities under the Civilian Health and Medical Program of the Uniformed Services. The Act establishes key terms related to the TRICARE program and military treatment facilities under the Civilian Health and Medical Program of the Uniformed Services. The Act mandates a demonstration project for the Department of Defense to receive reimbursement from the Medicare program for health services provided to certain Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries in geographic regions where the TRICARE program is implemented. The project will last for a maximum of 2 years, with reporting requirements. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services will submit an annual report to Congress 15 months after the project starts and a final report 90 days after it ends. The reports will include the number of Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries participating in the project. The demonstration project established under this section aims to assess the impact of easier access to the military treatment system on the number of Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries receiving health benefits. It also includes a list of primary health insurance plans and programs for these beneficiaries before their participation in the project. The demonstration project evaluates the enrollment of Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries in health plans and programs. It includes data on beneficiaries entitled to benefits under part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act and not enrolled under part B. The project also examines cost-shifting among medical care programs and its impact on the military treatment system's accessibility and space availability. The demonstration project evaluates the enrollment of Medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries in health plans and programs, including data on beneficiaries entitled to benefits under part A of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. It also examines cost-shifting among medical care programs and its impact on the military treatment system's accessibility and space availability. Additionally, it assesses the effects of the project on military treatment facility readiness, training, and overall Department of Defense medical readiness. The demonstration project evaluates the impact on the military health care system budget and individual military treatment facilities. It also considers the cost of prescription drugs to the Department of Defense and their accessibility to program beneficiaries. SEC. 4. REIMBURSEMENT AMOUNTS. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make monthly payments to the Department of Defense from the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund for medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries enrolled in the TRICARE program. The payments will be based on the relative weight of benefits from each Trust Fund. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make monthly payments to the Department of Defense for TRICARE program enrollees. Payments are based on the average adjusted per capita cost for medicare-eligible beneficiaries. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will make monthly payments to the Department of Defense for TRICARE program enrollees based on the average adjusted per capita cost for medicare-eligible beneficiaries. The payment amount is determined by the Secretary's estimates of the amounts for each health service provided during the month. The Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Health and Human Services will estimate a minimum enrollment number of medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries for a demonstration project. Monthly payments will be made to TRICARE program enrollees based on the average adjusted per capita cost for health services provided. The demonstration project requires eligible covered military beneficiaries to enroll in TRICARE program in each geographic region before the Department of Defense can receive payment. A minimum level of health services must be provided to medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries through military treatment facilities for payment to be received. The Department of Defense and Health and Human Services establish enrollment and health service requirements for medicare-eligible military beneficiaries to ensure equivalent projected expenditures. The Secretary of Health and Human Services, along with the Secretary of Defense, will set limits on the number of medicare-eligible military beneficiaries and health services covered under subsection (a). Additionally, the Secretary of Defense will waive TRICARE program enrollment fees for individuals receiving reimbursement under subsection (b)(1). The Medicare Subvention Fund is established under Section 5. The Medicare Subvention Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to make payments to the Secretary of Health and Human Services for medicare-eligible covered military beneficiaries. The Medicare Subvention Fund covers military beneficiaries exceeding enrollment limits and health service levels. It also covers administrative expenses and allows for other lawful purposes if funds are available. The Secretary of Defense can limit enrollment if funds are insufficient. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 1997 and 1998. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1997 and 1998 allows funds from the Department of Defense to be deposited in the Fund for specified purposes, without affecting the Department of Defense health affairs budget.
